Regulatory Class: Class II (Enzymatic Method, Creatinine); Class I (Single (specified) analyte controls (assayed and unassayed))
Methodologies: Coupled enzymatic reactions (creatininase, creatinase, sarcosine oxidase, peroxidase)
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for Diazyme Creatinine Liquid Reagents Assay and Control, an enzymatic in vitro assay for creatinine quantitation in serum and urine.
Indications for Use Summary: Quantitative determination of creatinine in serum and urine for diagnosis and treatment of renal diseases, monitoring renal dialysis, and as a calculation basis for measuring other urine analytes; control intended as a reference sample for monitoring the assay.
